description: Number of distinct primes = 1 mod 4 dividing n.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Additive with a(p^e) = 1 if p = 1 (mod 4), 0 otherwise.
mathematica: f[n_]:=Length@Select[If[n==1,{},FactorInteger[n]],Mod[#[[1]],4]==1&]; Table[f[n],{n,102}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Dec 18 2011 *)a[n_] := DivisorSum[n, Boole[PrimeQ[#] && Mod[#, 4] == 1]&]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 01 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) for(n=1,100,print1(sumdiv(n,d,isprime(d)*if((d-1)%4,0,1)),","))(Haskell)a005089 = sum . map a079260 . a027748_row-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 07 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
